page.title: 08The Police and Fire Service
page.content: Hornby has a village policeman who is responsible for the area concerned here. He has a large degree of autonomy and he can choose which hours to be on duty. As he is expected to work mainly on his own, he is trained to cope with a wide variety of situations. Public relations is very important in a small community and he is often asked for advice. The village policeman is responsible for the issue of licences, rgarding the movement of livestock and for firearms. Hornby has a small fire station and several retained firemen. Each person carries a personal receiver which alerts the firemen whenever they are required. The first six men to report to the station will man the fire engine. There is, on average, one call per week, which may be a fire, flood, road accident or rescuing animals.
